website_summaries.verdict: This model stands out with its high quality materials and design that can be adjusted to a variety of angles.
pros: Not only do users report being satisfied with the solid and strong design, but also its versatility and large size
We love that you can use it to dry shoes as well as clothing
cons: Although the model states it is rust-proof, some reported issues with rust, especially if used outdoors
The plastic portion of the unit could also be improved in terms of durability

customer_reviews.title: It's not really rust proof
customer_reviews.text: This rack is NOT Rust proof because after only a couple of weeks it started to rust as you can see in the pictures. Other then that I do love this rack cuz it suits my purpose well. I live in a small community with limited stores and have to order everything online since stuff like this is not available here otherwise I would buy elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: birgit

customer_reviews.title: Not rust proof
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this for six months and it is covered in rust spots. Not rust proof as described. If you live in a coastal/island area, buy the kind that is painted white. I have used one of that type for 2 years before the covering Became powdery and left white marks on clothes. This one had rust spots within 5 months. Also the plastic connectors are of lower quality and one has broken.
customer_reviews.author: JJ

customer_reviews.title: love the design of this rack HOWEVER it is most ...
customer_reviews.text: love the design of this rack HOWEVER it is most definitely not rust proof. It became rusty under a month. I bought it because of great reviews and advertisement that it was for indoor and outdoor use. Certainly not fit for outdoor use...i will keep looking
customer_reviews.author: Yana

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Love my drying rack. It's sturdy and still light. Folds flat to fit in between my washer and the wall when not in use, easy to bring outside in nice weather. This cloth diaper mama gives it five stars!
customer_reviews.author: Saraya

customer_reviews.title: Works great for us
customer_reviews.text: This is a true heavy duty drying rack. Works great for us. I like to dry my clothes outside in spring and summer, it does the job. It holds one full load from my washer. Very sturdy! Helps me do my bit by saving energy. It's expensive but it's worth it. Before this I had a drying rack from Walmart was so flimsy it would collapse everytime I would use hence I bought this one. I usually do a lot of research before buying this and it's worth investing. If you are looking to buy one, but this hands down!!
customer_reviews.author: ~Love2BMom

customer_reviews.title: Worries Misplaced
customer_reviews.text: There is always a worry about stainless steel claims and the strength of the metal with items like the one here. In this case, worries are misplaced. The product was far superior to what I imagined it would be. It includes actual stainless steel, solid construction, and high-quality plastic. This was an excellent purchase and I am very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Ivan Kline

customer_reviews.title: Very dissatisfied with the poor quality. "Heavy Duty" should never be used to ...
customer_reviews.text: Very dissatisfied with the poor quality. "Heavy Duty" should never be used to describe this product. The package it arrived in was dirty, tattered and ragged as well as having been re-taped to hold its contents inside. There was NO padding inside the box to protect the unit from the abuse the box received. Not surprisingly the unit was badly damaged with several bent and broken cross pieces. Again, it's not surprising the damage this thing incurred as the quality of the stainless steel is about as thin as possible. Its thickness is somewhat greater than a soda can. Add to that, the cheap plastic hinges hardly appear built for the Long haul.
customer_reviews.author: tttro

customer_reviews.title: Very happy!
customer_reviews.text: This dryer is exactly what I've been searching for! Instead of draping my kids' swim stuff all over the bathroom, I now have this. I put their swim suits and shirts, and whatever towels we've used on it, and leave it outside for a couple of hours to dry. So nice to finally have enough space to hang our family of five's wet swimwear. Looking forward to finding even more uses for this super versatile dryer!
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: It says HD... but not so much
customer_reviews.text: When I first received my Cresnel HD drying rack I was really pleased with the quality and drying space. After one month of use, both sides have bent at the pivot point and it’s ruined. Be careful putting too many wet jeans on one side (no more than three pairs) to avoid it bending. I bought this drying rack because it was supposed to be “heavy duty”, and I hang dry the majority of my clothes. Hopefully they improve the material so it lasts longer than 1 month of use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Well Made and Stows away easily
customer_reviews.text: After living in Europe for a while where many people used drying racks instead of dryers, we decided to get one when returning to the states to save energy. It takes longer, obviously, but it also makes clothes last longer, fold more easily, and we use significantly less energy, so it lowers our electric bill. This rack can hold old a full load of laundry, and is very well organized. When done, it stores easily in the space between the dryer and the wall. It is very durable, and we use it outside when the weather is warmer. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: John M Tufts

customer_reviews.title: Great drying rack, strong, durable, and compact storage
customer_reviews.text: So far this is the best drying rack we've ever had. It is much sturdier than the accordion/scissor lift style metal rack we had. I like that it is easy to unfold/expand and can hold many garments. I like that if I want, I can only open half of it to save space for smaller loads. I like that it folds up flat for easy storage. Main thing I like about this, is that it is sturdy and strong and can bear a lot more weight than other racks we;ve had.
customer_reviews.author: Karl

customer_reviews.title: For the garments that shouldn't be thrown in the dryer!
customer_reviews.text: I used to own one when I studied abroad in Germany and loved using it to dry my laundry since I didn't have a dryer in my home stay. After so many years passed I've decided to get one for my own home in California too. Even though we have a dryer at home, some clothes really shouldn't be thrown in a dryer to dry. For the delicate pieces, I prefer to use this drying rack instead. I chose this one because of the good reviews and I'm glad I did. It's very high quality and durable! No assembly required and easy to store away! Overall, love this!
customer_reviews.author: bi.ann

customer_reviews.title: Simple and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: My first indoor dryer to use when it’s raining and I can’t use my clothesline. I’m impressed! Initially I wondered if I’d have to get another one but it held a whole load of laundry from my front loader machine (I did get a three pack of clip hangers for socks and underwear, they’re hanging on the other side.)
customer_reviews.author: R

customer_reviews.title: The second one arrived today with 3 bent rods and wobbling pretty badly. Just did not want to deal with ...
customer_reviews.text: The first clothes rack I received was completely bent, so I returned it and ordered another one. The second one arrived today with 3 bent rods and wobbling pretty badly. Just did not want to deal with the hassle of retuning yet another one when I still have not been reimbursed for the first one. The only thing I do like about it, it's really light weight and easy to set up and fold down (hence the 2 stars).
customer_reviews.author: Diana Greiner

customer_reviews.title: So convenient
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this laundry rack. I try to dry my laundry outside as often as possible because I love the smell of sun dried clothes. Since it’s difficult to drape things over chairs and I don’t have a clothes line I knew I needed something. Last year I walked the camino de Santiago and saw these all over the place. I’m so happy I found this one. It is very lightweight and easy to fold. When the sun shifts to a different part of the deck it’s still easy to move. Why use a dryer when you can have amazing smelling sun dried clothes!
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Essential!
customer_reviews.text: HIGHLY recommend! This drying rack has come in handy every time for drying clothes economically, or drying things that can’t be heat-dried (bathroom rugs with rubber backing, delicates, etc.). It’s lightweight, yet durable. Just know that when it’s folded out completely, it can take up a noticeable amount of space (especially if you live in a smaller place). Don’t let this discourage you from purchasing - it’s still WORTH it.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Its super easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: I just replaced a stacked washer dryer in my condo with a washer/dryer combo. I had been foerwarned that my laundry would come out damp, so I wanted to be prepared to "line" dry any damp items. Sure thing, my first load was totally damp, so I whipped out my drying rack, and put the clothes on to finish. I'm experimenting with the drying time on my machine, and I think I've discovered ways to get my clothes dry in it, but I still have used the new rack to let them settle. I think I like the result better than "fresh" out of the dryer!
customer_reviews.author: SunnySD

customer_reviews.title: Not Rust Proof! Started rusting within a couple days!
customer_reviews.text: This can not be stainless steel. Started rusting within a couple days. Definitely not "Rust Proof". Caused rust stains on towels and clothes. Unfortunately, we did not begin using it until almost 30 days beyond purchase. No return option. Wish we would have read the 1 star reviews prior to our purchase. Waste of money. Just a piece of metal recycle trash now.
customer_reviews.author: TPT98

customer_reviews.title: No problems
customer_reviews.text: My drier gave out and I couldn't afford a new one right away so I used this for several months to dry all of our household laundry. It works great. To hang a large load, I had to use hangers on the ends for items that could hang dry on the hanger. Now that I have a drier again, it folds up and stores between the machines. It's quick to set up. Came in handy for drying snow gear. No rust issues.
customer_reviews.author: Christina

customer_reviews.title: Great space saver
customer_reviews.text: This rack is very easy to set up/take down and comes ready to use. It folds down thin enough that I can even slip it under my sofa for storage. It can hold quite a bit of clothes and does not tip if you put more weight on one side. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Ree Ann

customer_reviews.title: Fits The Bill
customer_reviews.text: I like the smell of clothes that have dried naturally in the sun and ocean breeze. I don’t have a yard large enough to hang a standard fixed clothes line (besides they are ugly) so I opted for this portable. It works great. Easy to set-up and store. I can hang a dozen shirts, drape a few pair of pants and a couple of hand towels across it. By the end of the day I can put everything away and store it neatly in my close. Yes, it is $15 too much (one start hit), but it seems to be of decent quality so I will get many uses from it. Exactly what I was looking for.
customer_reviews.author: political idiot

customer_reviews.title: Great lightweight drying rack
customer_reviews.text: I bought this drying rack for dry days outside or in my house. It is super lightweight and easy to move around. It fits my purposes perfectly. It is NOT heavy duty so I cannot imagine leaving it outside in weather! It is quite adjustable and has little plastic extension things that are moveable and can be use for hanging clothes off of like bras etc. I'm really pleased with it and would recommend if your goals are similar to mine.
customer_reviews.author: D.C.M.

customer_reviews.title: Happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.text: I needed something by our new pool to hang towels, etc. This does the trick. I've only used it for a couple of days, but I have no complaints. It says it is rust-proof, but it is too early to tell. It is sturdy and easy to fold and the price was fair. When pool season wraps up, it is compact enough that I can use it in the house too. One issue I have with this is it blows over and collapses even in just a moderate wind
customer_reviews.author: Mark Buck

customer_reviews.title: Very well made
customer_reviews.text: I have used this several times a week since my purchase. No assembly, well made, very easy to move around and holds a good amount of clothes that I prefer not to put in the dryer. Very stable and the adjustment on the arms makes it easy to hang longer things. It was well worth the money and I can not imagine not having it now. What in the world was I doing hanging my things all over the patio chairs? I would recommend this if you are looking for a convenient drying rack.
customer_reviews.author: Teaco

customer_reviews.title: Not made in America !  has a sticker on it 'Product of China'.
customer_reviews.text: I dislike buying anything made in China and I hate like heck being lied to. Amazon describers Manufacturer as 'American'. Product clearly has a 'Made in China' sticker on it. Incredibly deceitful. You should be ashamed Amazon and CRESNEL. Other shoppers...plenty of American Made options out there for like products. Do not be suckered like I have been.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and portable
customer_reviews.text: I didn't realize I would like this clothes dryer so much. It was recommended to me by a friend and even though it wasn't exactly what I was looking for, I decided to go for it. I absolutely love this rack. Even though it says heavy duty, believe me, it's not heavy at all. It IS well constructed but I can move it with ease. I use it about two times a month and store it the other time. I can open and close it easily and bring it out from it's hiding place with ease. And I even like the little shoe rack on the bottom for drying shoes. Great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Cookie's Mom

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price
customer_reviews.text: I know it’s not fun to pay this much for a drying rack but this is worth it compared to the other cheap ones I’ve purchased that have broke or couldn’t hold as many clothes. I highly recommend this for anyone looking to air dry their more “delicate” or “nicer clothes that they don’t want getting “pills” on or the fabric surface just becoming worn. It fold for and we store it under our bed. It’s convienent to pull out when we need it and place it back when we don’t.
customer_reviews.author: Marisa Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy Outdoor Clothes Rack
customer_reviews.text: I use this rack pretty regularly for my hand washed clothes or just instead of using my dryer and I love it. The stainless steel makes it great for using outside and it's really sturdy- haven't had it fall over or get pushed at all in the wind. It's really easy to set up and folds nice and flat to store pretty easily and out of the way. It also has adjustable angles which I find helpful for longer pants and such. I've fit a lot of clothes on here- including loads of heavy denim and it's done great.
customer_reviews.author: Caite Lynch

customer_reviews.title: Very light, easy to fold, But slippery
customer_reviews.text: I like to take this drying rack outside to dry my clothes. But often I will find my clothes on the floor because of wind, and the rack is quite slippery. Besides that, it has served its purpose. Be aware, if you run a large load, it won't be able to dry everything at once. (not enough space). And Large size and up t-shirts might not fit nicely. Happy Laundry days everyone :)
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Kim

customer_reviews.title: Hope its sturdy though feels very ligth.
customer_reviews.text: Had it delivered today. Ordered it thinking it would be sturdy as the reviews state but its very light. I like the space especially the bars below...its additional space. The bars that snap to hold up the wings are nice. No plastic parts here. But the rack is very light and I prefer heavy duty ones. This will definitely fall down in wind. Just hoping it doesn't rust because it doesn't feel like steel.
customer_reviews.author: hgujral

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and holds a lot of clothing!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this drying rack! It is heavy duty and is easy to set up. We have four children and it fits all their snow pants, coats, hats, mittens, etc. when they come in. It is much larger than the cheap drying rack we used to have-the one where the bars kept falling out. I don't think we will have that problem with this one. It is worth the extra space it takes up when set up. The best part is that is still folds up flat like our old one so I can store it at the same place.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Take care of it and it will last a long time in my opinion.
customer_reviews.text: Some reviews mentioned that they had rust appear on theirs after awhile, because the advertisement says rust proof. I found if you make sure it’s dry before putting it away helps. Also stainless can rust, but you still have to take care of it. A very helpful thing for drying some items of clothing, or laying out cloths in preparation for ironing.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy E. Schlitt

customer_reviews.title: I Truly Love it!
customer_reviews.text: My cousin recommended this and I totally love it. I don't know if it's safe to store outside but I do wish it had a rubber coating or something so I could easily use it and store it outside. There's nothing like clothes drying outside!
customer_reviews.author: MoonEmpath

customer_reviews.title: Forget the dryer!  Dry on this rack and save money!
customer_reviews.text: used these this summer while on vacation in Crete. They seem to have washing machines, but this is the desired way to dry clothes, at least in the summer months. I bought one as soon as I got home and now my sheets are crisp and smell like summer, even in the winter! Saves on electricity - good for the environment and the pocket. I have towels that my dryer won't dry completely, so I put them on this dryer for a couple of house and they are dry. Holds a great many items, even my tennis shoes have a place to dry.
customer_reviews.author: Irish Patsy

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely useable!
customer_reviews.text: I love this Rack. It's sturdy, dependable, useful. Other racks I purchased have been miserable to use. I can use this rack for large items, small, items, heavy items. It works real good. I can move it very quickly. I use it outdoors when it's sunny and indoors when it's raining. I leave it outside when I'm not using it. It still looks like new. The racks are adjustable and hold plenty.
customer_reviews.author: BECKY WARE

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE it.
customer_reviews.text: After dealing with an inexpensive rack that was supposed to fold and never would and the dang thing leaned when it had laundry on it I am so excited to wash my tee shirts and use this rack. Comes completely assembled and only requires taking out of the box, removing the plastic it is wrapped in and loosening the twist tie that holds it secure while shipping...you are set. All that needs to be done is the expansion. :) The rack is very sturdy. Does not require too much space for the amount of clothing it will hold. Thanks to the designers and thanks to Amazon for getting it to me a week before the expected delivery date!
customer_reviews.author: Wendy

customer_reviews.title: only because the style and functionality of the rack is good, however
customer_reviews.text: I gave the clothes rack two stars, only because the style and functionality of the rack is good, however, I received the rack with several dents in the legs, not a game changer, didn't want to deal with the hassle of returning it and it didn't affect its use. My biggest complaint is that it has started to rust. Sort of defeats the purpose of being able to hang wet clothes from it. Disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Monica

customer_reviews.title: Impressed with the quality for the price!
customer_reviews.text: We have purchased quite a few racks in the last 8 years. None have compared to the quality of this Cresnel clothes drying rack. Easy to setup and simple to fold and put away. I believe that we will be able to use this for a long time without it rusting up and falling apart like some of our previous purchases.
customer_reviews.author: DenAlex89

customer_reviews.title: Rusted out
customer_reviews.text: Rusted out in a few months outside. Maybe it's ok indoors
customer_reviews.author: JLG

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with my purchase
customer_reviews.text: I actually did not buy this for hanging laundry, I bought it because I was going to a craft fair and needed something to hang the crocheted scarves on. It worked excellent! I was able to display a lot of scarves and did not have to have them piled up on a table. However, I have used it for hanging my clothes on it also, I have not hung my clothes on it directly, I hung my shirts and blouses on hangers. Again, it worked excellent. Very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Barb Wyre

customer_reviews.title: Great quality and heavy duty
customer_reviews.text: I use this sturdy drying rack for indoor use only daily. It came already assembled and can hold a substantial amount of clothing and weight. I wash area rugs and other heavy garments frequently and the rack is durable to hold it all. Every laundry room should have this. Makes it enjoyable to do the laundry and will keep your clothes in good shape versus using the dryer. Saves you money, too :)
customer_reviews.author: Julie Westerman

customer_reviews.title: Great drying rack.
customer_reviews.text: Love this drying rack. Has plenty of room and can configure to accommodate clothes on hangers as well. So much better than the wood racks that wobble and break down as well as other metal racks where the end screws loosen and come apart. I don’t know how well it would hold up if I stored it outside and it was subjected to various weather elenents, but it is perfect for indoor drying. Also love that it folds up flat as I live in a condo and don’t have a lot of storage. Slides easily into closet when not in use. So far, this is the best drying rack I have ever owned.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Holds SO MUCH laundry!
customer_reviews.text: At first I wasn't sure how reviewers could get so hyped about a drying rack, but now I see the appeal. It's super flexible in how you can use it, and I can get a whole load of laundry on it, easily. It's lightweight and simple to use. It does take up a pretty sizable footprint, but I think it just has to to hold so much laundry. I'm able to make it work in my small one bedroom apartment just fine. So happy I bought this.
customer_reviews.author: MKM

customer_reviews.title: Great clothes drying rack.
customer_reviews.text: I thought this drying rack might be a bit more than I was looking for, but it was exactly what I wanted and didn't know it. I was just going to use it for laying sweaters and blouses to dry flat, but I have also draped tablecloths over it, dried doilies on it, etc. And I've dried wet sneakers on it too. Very handy, and much appreciated. Very well made, it's sturdy and I see a long and happy future with it.
customer_reviews.author: G. Nevius

customer_reviews.title: Decent
customer_reviews.text: Meh. Very big and sort of clumsy. Not 100% stable so if you move one side and you're not paying attention, the other side falls down (the part that is elevated). It's okay though and better than having nowhere to hang things if you're in a small apartment or dorm. It was relative easy to put together initially and easy to collapse and store in a closet or under a bed. It just takes up a LOT of space when it's open so be sure to measure well before buying or you'll be in for a surprise when it shows up.
customer_reviews.author: Chiadgirl

customer_reviews.title: Works great for me outside !
customer_reviews.text: I live in a 28 ft. trailer with alot of stuff. This works really great if I use it outside. The wind gets pretty gusty here so I put a cinder block on the bar across the feet and it stays put. Works good and my clothes have that fresh smell that they can't get in a dryer.
customer_reviews.author: Wndwalker

customer_reviews.title: I love how much drying area there is
customer_reviews.text: I love how much drying area there is, however, it isn't built very strong. It can hold up the clothes if you are gentle with it, but when you've got multiple teenagers helping with the laundry and just piling it willy-nilly the arm can bend, and then there's no going back. I love the shoe area, and small items underneath. If it were built with better material, I would have given it a 5 star.
customer_reviews.author: Hilda

customer_reviews.title: Good buy; but one bar was slightly bent.
customer_reviews.text: Just arrived. The product is good. I did notice a slightly bent (warped) bar that must have been like that from the manufacturer. One of the bars across wasn't straight but it wasn't worth the trouble to ship it back. The slight bend definitely didn't happen in the shipping process. It came in a huge cardboard box and the product was wrapped within so it definitely happened at the factory and was assembled that way. It's a large clothes-dryer that can definitely hold jeans or sheets (without them touching the floor if the arms are positioned correctly. We'll see if the product holds up over time.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher D.

customer_reviews.title: ... purchased it a couple of weeks ago and it's terrific! Folds up very thin for storage (I keep ...
customer_reviews.text: Have used this several times since I purchased it a couple of weeks ago and it's terrific! Folds up very thin for storage (I keep it in the couple of inches between the washing machine and the wall in my laundry closet), and holds a LOT of clothes if you're creative about how you hang them. Very sturdy. A wet pair of jeans on the end doesn't tip this thing.
customer_reviews.author: Idaho Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Good for what I bought it for
customer_reviews.text: I like that it's light-weight, easy to open and close, and easily stored (not too thick when closed). I like the versatility of different levels, to lay flat sweaters or t-shirts, and socks or towels if still alittle damp out of dryer. The material is aluminum and plastic which helps to make it light, but the aluminum can warp. When it was shipped, 2 of the poles were warped.
customer_reviews.author: Annieand5pups

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Capacity and Easy To Store
customer_reviews.text: This thing holds more clothes than I ever imagined! It folds up nicely and easily slips into tight spaces.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Jones

customer_reviews.title: This product is OK per my experience
customer_reviews.text: I was really looking forward to like this product. It looks great but doesn't feel great. Overall very light weighted and fall down easily in moderate wind. Not meant for small place (it wasn't a concern for me though) but my major complain is this product is made of hollow stainless steel and so doesn't hold to ground as it should be. And for the same reason I felt it is pricey compare to the quality.
customer_reviews.author: Priti Mehta

customer_reviews.title: easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: I just used this once and was pleased with it. The set up was quick and easy, and you can change the angle on the wings. Also when I looked at my laundry basket of wet clothes I was sure I wouldn't get it all hung up, by using hangers for shirts i got it all on. I can use indoors or outdoors depending on the weather.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth R Iverson

customer_reviews.title: Big and sturdy.  The Cadillac of drying racks!
customer_reviews.text: Big and sturdy. The Cadillac of drying racks! I keep it in a spare bedroom with a fan to help dry the laundry, as my laundry room is a walkway from the garage. Once, my dryer broke and I had to hang dry several load of clothes. It held all my towels, plus shirts, etc. It has spaces to dry shoes as well. I've had this item 2 years and it is still the best one I've ever owned.
customer_reviews.author: anj

customer_reviews.title: This is a wonderful drying rack
customer_reviews.text: This is a wonderful drying rack. Its very large (compared to other similar drying racks I've used) but not too big and bulky when folded up. Its very sturdy and well constructed and seems like it will last for many years. It will definitely be able to hold alot of heavy, wet clothes. Upon arrival, it came well packaged and did not have any scratches, dents, or rust. It was well worth the higher price and I'm extremely satisfied with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Hawaii customer

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight, easy to move and fold
customer_reviews.text: I bought it 3 years ago and it’s still going strong! No rust whatsoever, although I only use it indoors. It’s lightweight and I can lift it and fold it with one hand (I’m a petite person). The only issue is I accidentally threw away the stabilizing plastic piece that fits on the bottom, and it wobbles teeny bit so make sure you keep all the parts!
customer_reviews.author: A

customer_reviews.title: The Hinge is its Achilles heel
customer_reviews.text: I'm glad Amazon has pre-written a five star review on my behalf ( that I painstakingly had to delete). Maybe that's why there's so many Stellar reviews. This is my favorite drying rack because most are garbage. This one is better than the rest but its weak point is the plastic hinge. I've had to repair it at least four times with epoxy and it's finally ready for the trash. But yes I'm buying another. Just wish they sold replacement parts or better yet made the hinge out of metal
customer_reviews.author: Richard S.

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely fantastic item! Stores very well
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely fantastic item! Stores very well, extremely sturdy, holds over a load of clothes, can also hold an entire queen comforter, does not rust, clothes are ventilated and dry very quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Croy

customer_reviews.title: Well made and versatile
customer_reviews.text: It’s got a reasonable footprint folded and unfolded, holds a medium size laundry load, and is very sturdy and well made. I use it partially folded when I have just a few items to dry or just fold one side out, so it’s pretty versatile, too.
customer_reviews.author: RedHal

customer_reviews.title: Great quality. But I have not been able to ...
customer_reviews.text: Great quality. But I have not been able to use it outside with our RV; that will be the real test for me. In the past I have used wooden drying racks but they break by the end of the trip (1 week). I have bought other metal racks and they rust in a few days or break at the welds. I just have 1 wish to make it perfect, to have a mess cloth that would allow small items to dry on the rack.
customer_reviews.author: anna

customer_reviews.title: Just what I thought
customer_reviews.text: I like this little clothes drier! It's light weight, holds about a load of clothes (there are a couple of us), and doesn't turn over. It fits in the space between my washer and the wall for storage. I wouldn't leave it outside, but for drying outside and then bringing in, it's great!
customer_reviews.author: R. Tate

customer_reviews.title: Great for camping
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for the fold up convenience when I go camping. I don't like messy camp sites with wet stuff strewn all over. I don't put ropes between trees. When I saw this, I thought this would be neat and easy to store for camping. I used it last weekend and loved it. It works great. It's larger than I thought, but that just allows you to lay the wet stuff out in addition to hanging it. Keeps the camp site nice and neat
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Solid choice for apartment dwellers
customer_reviews.text: You know you're getting old when your favorite purchase of the year is a clothes drying rack. It was purchased to replace a cheap, standard accordion style drying rack, which I accidentally broke. Actually, 'broke' might be too kind. With minimal effort, it was completely destroyed. It was as if it was held together with only toothpicks, hopes and dreams. The CRESNEL drying rack is a quality product that holds an unexpectedly large volume of clothing, offers multiple configurations for hanging different types of clothing, and is sturdy. This drying rack is a must-have for apartment dwellers who struggle to find places to dry their clothing items. I've routinely hung entire loads of laundry at one time on this rack.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Don't need a dryer anymore
customer_reviews.text: This was a great purchase. Ever since we acquired this product, we have not used or found the need to use our dryer. So far so good. We make sure not to put too heavy load esp on the far ends and put the heavier loads in the middle
customer_reviews.author: Reyna M.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for what it is-put away after each use
customer_reviews.text: This has worked out well for drying a bath towel every morning out on the deck or drying just a few pieces of clothing. Not big enough for an entire load of wash but I have done 3-4 tee shirts some underwear and socks.
customer_reviews.author: Vanns40

customer_reviews.title: no rust and great hockey gear dryer
customer_reviews.text: I use this daily - my boys use it for Hockey gear drying and it is perfect. I am in a dry climate and have not had any rust issues and have had it almost a year now.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle L. White

customer_reviews.title: This is good for heavy thicker clothing - but lightweight things that ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a large drying rack - I compare it to an older rack that is enamel coated steel with more narrow bars and more of them. This is good for heavy thicker clothing - but lightweight things that are what we usually air dry - like sporting clothes, silky underwear, etc - these slide of the rack as it is slippery and has a wider girth! Good if you want to hand bigger things like jeans, towels etc. Not so great for the delicates!
customer_reviews.author: Sherrie

customer_reviews.title: Very functional and folds easily
customer_reviews.text: I love this clothes rack. I use it for all of my delicates, my shirts, dresses and bikinis hang dry without touching each other. I use this product indoors because I live in Miami where it is humid. It folds up and I can store it behind my full length mirror when not in use.
customer_reviews.author: Miami Glow

customer_reviews.title: Second purchase
customer_reviews.text: I recently purchased another one because my daughter swiped the first oneI purchased about 4 years ago. While this rack may cost more than others on the market, it's well-built and the reviews are well-deserved.
customer_reviews.author: Amz Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good purchase.
customer_reviews.text: It does the job. Doesn't seem to be of great quality but I'm hoping it lasts. Some reviews complained about rust. No issues so far.
customer_reviews.author: J. Cracco

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I have had this for about 6 months and can report that it is versatile, well-designed, durable, and easy to store. I have used it inside and outside for drying clothes and airing out comforters. It is a great improvement over the wooden rack it replaced. I highly recommend it. And it is attractive.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Katz

customer_reviews.title: Great drying rack for any need!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great drying rack! I have had similar racks, but the bars were not welded to the frame as one piece so they would slip out. This is sturdy, the bars are connected to the frame and it is great! It makes drying a breeze! I would recommend this rack to anyone who needs to air dry clothes. I can dry a ton of close, including my heavy jeans. I keep it in the garage because it is a bit large and I dont want drips on my laminate floors. Very sturdy, very versatile, folds easily for storage when not in use.
customer_reviews.author: Betty A Neumann

customer_reviews.title: Works great and easy to store
customer_reviews.text: I love the way my air dry clothes feel and I do believe it helps them last longer. This rack gives you plenty of hanging options, folds to store easily, and is lightweight and easy to set up. Great item
customer_reviews.author: Omaha Reader

customer_reviews.title: Rip off!
customer_reviews.text: This item worked great for about 35 days....long enough for the 30 day warranty to run out. It is unstable and blows over with the slightest breeze. Which broke the one side. If I could return it I would. Don't buy this product!!!
customer_reviews.author: barbara ritchey

customer_reviews.title: Go for it
customer_reviews.text: Love this!! I don’t dry most of my running / workout clothes and quite a few of my regular more delicate items. Two good sized loads of shirts, shorts, bras, etc fit on there. Really like that the shoe holders are included and easily snap off when I don’t need them. Laid a king size comforter on it as well. It’s lightweight so I can fold it up, move it around, carry it without strain. Very happy with this!
customer_reviews.author: DEB

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!
customer_reviews.text: This rack does everything it's supposed to do. It's strong, it's light, it's compact when folded and the manufacturer backs it's warranty and then some. I left my clothes on the rack outside in a windstorm and the rack was thrown down with such force it broke two of the plastic hinges. When I mentioned this to the Manufacturer they sent me out two replacement hinges even though this accident was my fault. I am a very happy customer!
customer_reviews.author: Glen

customer_reviews.title: Good Drying Rack
customer_reviews.text: Check dimensions before buying - lot's of people don't and go "ohh its too big/small". It's perfect size (in my opinion). The quality of the materials is superb, the functionality is great and it stows away nicely in the corner.
customer_reviews.author: Sev S.

customer_reviews.title: Very versatile must have product.
customer_reviews.text: I don't know why I didnt buy this before! I can fit almost a full load of clothes to dry. Very versatile. You can lay clothes on top of each wing. You can hang them from the various slats on the wings or the bottom middle section. Both wings can be raised higher, especially if you have a longer shirts that's hung off a hanger on the side. It folds flat and is fairly slim. It is still bit bulky, but that doesn't bother me. There's a shoe formations on the bottom. I haven't really used this feature.
customer_reviews.author: maybreeze01

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up, easy to take down, easy to lift = Good
customer_reviews.text: I have been very pleased with this stainless clothes drying rack. Because I am mechanically challenged, I was afraid I'd have trouble setting up this rack. Not to worry ... it's easy (and painless) to set up and take down. It's light-weight -- I can lift if with one hand, an important feature for me. I have a couple of old wood clothes racks and the wood rungs have started to stain light-colored clothes. I don't anticipate this problem with the stainless steel rack.
customer_reviews.author: collies and cats

customer_reviews.title: great purchase
customer_reviews.text: perfect clothes hanger. decided to purchase these after visiting Ikea and seeing how cheap their hangers looked. this one definitely does the job and i'm not afraid that my head clothing will make the hanger off balanced and tip over. nicely made and i'm able to hang dry a lot of my outfits at once so thats definitely a plus. if you're in the market for one of these, this is a great option
customer_reviews.author: min2be

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE this drying rack
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this drying rack. This is so helpful for us as we have a small laundry room & nowhere to hang or lay dress clothes to dry. I usually lay out a towel over the top of this rack to lay sweaters on (can usually fit two alongside my hanging pants on the other end). There's room to lay out another shirt on the bottom. Seems durable, was extremely easy to unpack & set up, and folds away flat so you can stick it in a closet if you need to.
customer_reviews.author: NebraskaMamaTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Works ok for our RV. It did have a ...
customer_reviews.text: Works ok for our RV. It did have a couple of burrs in the metal where the horizontal rods go through. These can catch your clothes so need to be filed off.
customer_reviews.author: DIY Guy

customer_reviews.title: Substantial
customer_reviews.text: With winter coming up and sweaters needing air drying, I am liking this rack thus far. It is lightweight and folds easily. It is a great substantial size. The only reason I did 4 instead of 5 stars is that I worry about the two thin mounts that hold up the size over the long term. I dry some pretty heavy sweaters and I worry about them holding that kind of weight over the long term. But so far, so good :-)
customer_reviews.author: Angie

customer_reviews.title: Good buy.
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this for a month or two now and have had no issues. It holds a whole loud of laundry including jeans and sweatshirts. No rust so far. Only thing I wish is that it was wider for jeans and a little more space between the bottom part and where things hang above it. Feel like it’s harder to dry when something is laying on it from above.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah C

customer_reviews.title: this is the best product I have ordered from Amazon
customer_reviews.text: I waited almost a year and a half to write this review. To date, this is the best product I have ordered from Amazon. Do not hesitate. Purchase this clothes line. For a year and a half, it has held multiple loads of laundry. Bath mats. Sheets. Jeans. Sweaters. Shirts. Sneakers, etc. The clothes line simply works. It can hold a lot of clothes at one time. I only use it indoors. After a year and a half, It has not shown any signs of rusting or wear and tear. I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Adelgrad

customer_reviews.title: Best drying rack I've ever owned
customer_reviews.text: We lived in Europe for several years, and we were mostly without dryer units. This meant we had to buy drying racks, which were actually very expensive for decent models. This one is both less expensive and more durable than anything we've ever owned. It's light-weight, but it's designed to so that the pressure is distributed across the metal and hard plastic parts. There's no single part that's vulnerable to breakage. Our daughter frequently knocks it over, but it has never broken or even shown signs of wear.
customer_reviews.author: Trevor Maine

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for pool patio
customer_reviews.text: We use this outside it is not under a covered porch has been outside for a month already and NO rust NO falling over its literally perfect for all our pool towels i would purchase again!
customer_reviews.author: NY shopaholic

customer_reviews.title: Very useful
customer_reviews.text: It’s really good, I just love how it folds and it makes really easy to dry cloths outside or inside. I recommend get some clips to hold the cloths because it’s kinda slippery with sportswear etc.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Folds up quite nice, sturdy
customer_reviews.text: This folds up really nicely to fit next to my washer. Sturdy enough to hold clothes on all the bars and has much more area than the other sort of "criss-cross" style racks that I used in the past.
customer_reviews.author: Crugen

customer_reviews.title: Convenient and Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my son who just moved into his first house. Got him a washer and dryer which were installed in the basement, but nowhere to hang things that you don't want to wrinkle or that aren't supposed to go in the dryer. Just got him some plastic hangers to leave on the rack. Works like a charm...very convenient and sturdy. Good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Sister Carol

customer_reviews.title: It's a great drying rack.
customer_reviews.text: We've had two of these drying racks for over three years and we definitely recommend this unit. We keep our drying rack indoors and use it in Colorado (yes it's dry here) and we have not seen any rust or quality issues with the rack. Folds down so it can be tucked away when we don't need it. It's very sturdy and we've never had any issues with balance when we load it up with wet clothes.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Weisgerber

customer_reviews.title: Flexible & Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been using this regularly for about a month now, and I hang dry a lot of clothing. This has been a sturdy clothes rack with lots of good surface area. I can hang blouses on hangers, flat dry sweaters, and I like the shoe holders. I wish I would have bought this sooner. The rack had a small dent in one of the rods (I suspect from delivery in that HUGE box), but nothing that affects performance. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: CK

customer_reviews.title: Always good to have on hand
customer_reviews.text: I love this drying rack. It's good quality, well-made and easy to use and easy to store. I don't have a clothesline, yet sometimes I need to and want to dry things in the fresh air or I even use this indoors in my laundry room. Great product, won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Mickey10

customer_reviews.title: LAUNDRY MUCH EASIER
customer_reviews.text: Can be used in many combos, compact to all the way . folds very slim easy to store out of the way. fits perfectly on my balcony fully extended. in bathroom half fits inside tub. extensions can be raised to various heights. The laundry in my complex is in the building next door and I live on the 2nd floor, no elevator. 69 years old. This has been a life saver.
customer_reviews.author: Belindadenorth

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for drying everything, including my queen sized sheets!
customer_reviews.text: I wouldn't have thought to buy this until a Della washing machine buyer suggested it to dry my queen sized sheets. Now I dry everything on this rack. Let me warn you, this thing is huge! Plenty of room to dry my sheets and I can get two wash loads on this thing. The box it came in was messed up but the rack was not damaged. Best of all - IT COMES COMPLETELY PUT TOGETHER! All you have to do is lift the wings and pull the metal pieces up to hold up the wings. I have to admit, this is the reason I bought this model.
customer_reviews.author: Denise P

customer_reviews.title: great rack with lots of drying room, compact when stored
customer_reviews.text: I have had a wooden drying rack for about 10 years. The paint had been peeling off for about 4 years. I finally purchased this Stainless Steel Clothes Drying Rack and it is making me wonder why I waited so long. It folds up compactly. It fits in between my dryer and wall. My previous rack had to hang in the garage. It has a lot of drying space and when I lay the sides out flat they make for a great sweater drying rack. I am very happy with this purchase. My only question is how long it will last, time will tell.
customer_reviews.author: dgve

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, good design & good quality steel
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this CRESNEL Stainless Steel Clothes Drying Rack (Adjustable Gullwing and Foldable for Easy Storage) for more than 2 years now. It is sturdy and can take considerable amount of weight. The steel is good - nothing has rusted yet. The folding design is good. Even if there are clothes drying on it, I can maneuver it from one room to another.
customer_reviews.author: Vighanesh patil

customer_reviews.title: Great drying rack
customer_reviews.text: I bought this rack to replace a wooden rack that I had had for many years, that was becoming very rickety. This rack is amazing. It sets up quickly and easily. I use it on the deck for drying underwear and things I don't want to put in the dryer. It holds a large amount of clothes. I am very pleased
customer_reviews.author: momskijean

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful product.
customer_reviews.text: I didn't think I could like a clothes dryer this much. Sturdy build and easy set up. Holds more than enough weight for a full load of laundry. I would highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Miso

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Love this drying rack. We have 3 people who need to dry most tops and this helps a lot. It's worked great for laying sweaters to dry and under garments. It collapses and opens up pretty easily and is not heavy. Also offers some adjustment in size. So happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Alicia E Hoffman

product_meta.title: CRESNEL Stainless Steel Clothes Drying Rack – Adjustable Gullwing and Foldable for Easy Storage – Rust-Proof for Indoor and Outdoor Use
product_meta.description: Unlike typical painted steel or chrome plated rack, this rack is made of pure stainless steel. Only stainless steel rack can be used both indoor and outdoor without becoming rusty. Its versatile foldable design allows easy storage without taking up spaces. This quality drying rack rack is covered with money back satisfaction guarantee, and 1 year manufacturer warranty.
feature_bullets: Original Cresnel brand now with 2019 newly improved quality. Besides indoor use this rack can now withstand outdoor use under direct sunshine or rain without becoming rusty. This rust-proof claim is backed by Cresnel free lifetime replacement warranty.

Expansive top planar area of 58” x 24” provides generous drying area for typical household wash load. Hang dry your laundry onto the multiple rails or with hanger for an even larger load. Bottom rack will accommodate shoes and slippers.

Weight approximately 7lb it is highly portable allowing it to be moved from indoor to outdoor or room to room easily. When not in used, it is foldable into flat rectangular shape of 40” x 24” x 3” for storage without taking up significant space.
Comes fully assembled in sealed plastic wrap. No tools required, just expand the rack into “A” shape and flip up the left/right panel and it is ready for drying action.
The long-term energy cost saved from utilizing this drying rack will more than pay for the rack itself. Good for your wallet and good for our environment.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.7 out of 5 stars3,638 ratings4.7 out of 5 stars
